Reviews.Title: “super convenient”
Reviews.Author: Debbi M
Reviews.Content: The hotel has free parking and is a block from the subway, which we took to Universal City (tip: the subway tickets have an expiration time, so only buy them one-way). There is a grocery store, a jamba juice and a starbucks practically next store and a drugstore on the corner. There are many inexpensive and tasty Thai restaurants in a couple of blocks. The courtyard echos sounds, so it is a bit noisy if you are a light sleeper. We were able to walk around the neighborhood in the early evening without feeling threatened, but we did see beggers and drunks and there were sirens during the night. The hotel has bars on the first floor windows. Our room had a clean shower, but no tub. There is a hot tub and pool in the courtyard, open 9am-9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Good motel for this price”
Reviews.Author: KarineDav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for three nights. We chose it because of free parking and the neiborghood. It's close to the subway. It was not a close as we expect from the Chinese theatre but you can take the subway. Our room was clean and quiet enough. We enjoy the hot tub too. The service was very welcoming. Overall, this motem is good for the price we pay, especially in LA.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: stevestevesteve_11
Reviews.Content: A slightly run-down but clean and safe budget hotel, practically next door to the Western metro station on an unfashionable part of Hollywood Boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was clean, convenient, the staff is wonderful. Do not let the location or the front of the hotel discourage you. It is very safe as anyone that goes in has to be buzzed in not just anyone can walk through the place. Again I loved it, and I am grossed out by dirty places. This was anything but that it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lailo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7th Feb - 13th Feb. I went to Hollywood from London,UK with another girl and Hotel staff were very helpful from the time we arrived at the hotel, they advised us about the vicinity, food, shopping taxi etc. The guys at reception always made conversation and did all the taxi bookings, printed us maps and told us the best places to shop (Thanks to the guy that gave us the heads up on the Armani shop on Sunset Strip and also Vctoria's Secret at the Farmer's market, so sorry I didn't get your name). The Area was very safe, everything you could ever need was at least 2mins away( bank, phamacy, supermarkets, hair salon etc). Very clean too. The courtyard was really clean, the swimming pool and jacuzzi are treated daily. It felt like home after a couple of days, thanks for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: WickedSmaht
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights Feb 16-21. Mom had never been to LA so I brought her for a vacation. Being on a budget, I came across this little gem. Don;t let the strange facade of a plantation house fool you. The inside is an oasis in the city. A great courtyard with vegetation, hot tub, and pool greet you as soon as you exit the lobby. Rooms are basic, but some of the cleanest I have encountered in hotels. Next door is a plaza with a supermarket, shopping, and restaurants.(check out "Out of the closet", a great little thrift shop) Being a half block from Hollywood Boulevard, you are close to the Metro and minutes from the Kodak theater and Graumann's. There is also free wi-fi and a laundry room. Beds were a little to firm for my taste, but not a huge issue. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a clean place to lay your head. Only downside was lack of breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Squeaky clean”
Reviews.Author: Jinyx
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap place to stay in the land of tinsel , you could do a lot worse than the coral sands. Room rates are $75 per night and more than worth that!. The rooms are not up to the standards of the four seasons, but would you really expect that for Such a low price ?. Although basic, and a little tatty , our room was the cleanest I have encountered in a budget hotel. They don't sting you for extras as a lot of cheap motels do. Included in the price is free parking, a decent safe, a coffee machine with real ground coffee, a fridge, and the best shower I have come across in any hotel including 5* hotels. If your feeling up to it they even have a clean jacuzzi and a big swimming pool. I wouldn't recommend it for families , as the rooms are a tad small but, otherwise, a really good find........ Well done!!.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Joannelips
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for 2 nights in January 2012 and was really impressed.. great location, the staff were the most friendly we experienced on our road trip from Vegas to San Fran & went out of their way to help us.. rooms were basic but clean & had everything you need.. theres a washing machine/dryer & microwave to use.. felt very safe.. free wifi & car parking!

Reviews.Title: “Just right for a Hollywood stay”
Reviews.Author: jeanjeanie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights pre-cruise in December, we wanted something central to the sights that wouldn't break the budget. Whilst it was not a flashy hotel, it was the cleanest place I have ever stayed - all of the room was clean, every corner, lamp, the pipes behind the sink etc. someone cleaned the parking lot every morning - removing every last cigarette butt, our room (101) was on the ground floor quite near the entrance so I was worried about noise, but I was never woken once - we didn't use the pool or Jacuzzi as it was cold, but again it all seemed clean and well cared for. We had a car and there is plenty of free parking but used the metro to go to the Kodak Theatre - it's just a 5 min walk, as is a Starbucks, CVS, & Ralphs supermarket, it had a fridge which the swanky airport hotel we booked at the end of our vacation didn't, though the room was smaller - we saw couples, mixed and same sex, and families staying here I would use it again if we returned to Hollywood - because of the location, and the fact the owners clearly cared about the property - all the staff were very polite and friendly but if they didn't know us always checked our ID which was good ....recommended, as long as you are not expecting the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “No luxury, but you can't beat the price for the location.”
Reviews.Author: road_foodie
Reviews.Content: I have heard sketchy things about this motel just a few years back. However, the motel has turned itself around. The location is great, within walking distance to Thai town. The metro is also just about 5 minutes walk away. There is enough parking for one car per room. The room was basic, but was clean. If you are just looking for a safe and affordable place in this area, this motel definitely fits the bill. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Mike
Reviews.Content: If you want 4 or 5 star accommodation, this is not the place for you, but if you want a good basic place to stay in LA, this will fit the bill. Older building, but kept immaculate and you can't beat the location. Steps away from the subway, and a short drive if you have a car to all of the central city. Our room was quiet, very clean and the small refrigerator and safe were welcome additions. We didn't swim, but the pool and jacuzzi had the cleanest water of any place we've ever stayed at, and even though it is in a very busy Hollywood location, it was just far enough away from all the traffic that we never were bothered by city noise. We will stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good motel”
Reviews.Author: hrg24
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. Room was good, clean, fridge, ok bed, but it is very noisy so you can hear everything thats going on outside. Pool seemed good. Location is great. Free parking. Supermarket, pharmacy and starbuks 2 min walk from the motel. It is good value for money I assume, compared to other motels in LA. It is rather expensive staying in LA, so I thought it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ick.”
Reviews.Author: misswhirledtraveler
Reviews.Content: We got there at night and the place looked super sketchy. The front desk person had to buzz us into the hallway (nice safety measure I guess). The hallway and stairwell were poorly lit and I almost fell down the stairs. Got to our room and it looked like the carpet and bedding hadn't been changed since the '70s - they were filthy and threadbare. The bathroom door didn't stay shut and the bathroom was tiny (if I bent over just a little to use the sink, my butt hit the door and swung it open). The TV was the size of my work computer, super tiny. I was scared my fiance and I would get lice and/or bedbugs, but thankfully there's been no sign of that... yet! And no free breakfast in the morning?! Just as well, since at this place you could probably just expect some dry old nasty bread and some juice (still though, a modest little breakfast would have made the whole experience a little nicer). Thank God the parking was free and there was hot water (kinda) to shower with. The pool and hot tub looked nice, but I never saw anyone using them and we didn't have time. The front desk people were nice, for LA people. For the price we paid - nearly $100 for the night - my wallet and my dignity were left a little wounded. I felt we could have done a lot better. Do yourself a favor and either spend a little more money to stay somewhere nice, or go somewhere out of the city to stay somewhere cheaper AND nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Hollywood Bowl”
Reviews.Author: Music_Traveler_PHX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in LA for a show at the Hollywood Bowl, which is a short subway ride and then a 10-15 min walk, from the hotel. The hotel featured friendly service, a pool and free parking. We spent little time in the room but it was clean, comfortable and secure. Although the building is old they still have wi-fi. I would stay here again, especially if an event at the Hollywood Bowl was in the works.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place for LA - Clean & wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sostraone
Reviews.Content: My stay was great at this motel, it's very clean even if it's an old fashion motel. Essential furniture, great pool and jacuzzi, helpful and kind staff and the most important is that it is very clean. Laundry available on spot that is very convenient. Subway transportation and buses around the corner, supermarket next door. Whatever people can say about Hollywood and his crowd the area was not dirty and very safe. I will come back for sure !

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff, great motel”
Reviews.Author: ab36
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August 2011 for five days while exploring LA. The motel was great, room wasa little dated but very comfortable and clean with a fridge and coffee making facilities. Bathroom was clean and functional. The best part about the place is the pool and hot tub which were great and really pleasant after a hot day in the city. The staff are amazingly helpful and offered so many great bits of advice. It was very quiet at night and yes it's a gay-friendly motel but this does not exclude non-gay couples and families - basically everyone is welcome here! Also v. close to the metro which is handy.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not too bad either”
Reviews.Author: beeci
Reviews.Content: Gay friendly, nice pool in garden, nice staff at reception, good location to Sunset and Hollywood Blvs, free parking, free wi-fi, the rooms are a little poor-equipped and old fashioned, but they're ok.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Day_tripper1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and we had a good experience! The Motel feels secure because you have to show ID to pass the front desk into the motel building. Dont expect the ritz and you'll be suprised. The rooms were only small and the bathrooms were tiny but it was adequete and very clean. The AC unit was great and was very cooling which was great! we knew this hotel was "gay friendly" and we were a hetrosexual couple and we really didnt mind, but we got a few strange looks at points but nothing to be concerned about, The area around the motel is not the greatest but not the worste by far i felt quite safe walking around and the metro station is on the next block which is awesome, The hotel staff are really helpful and friendly and will give good information on the area aswell as other tourist needs. Overall we had a good stay the only bad thing was the beds were abit hard but other then that we were happy

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price! FREE parking & internet!”
Reviews.Author: raincheck88
Reviews.Content: It's old and by no means perfect. The neighborhood isn't the worst in Hollywood, but if you've lived a privileged life and never "roughed" it much you might find it repulsive. However, if you go into it knowing it's an old motel in a pretty crappy neighborhood you'll be pleasantly surprised. The rooms have fridges, there's a pool & jacuzzi, a computer room with free internet, a pay washer and dryer & a microwave. If you are a gay man and interesting in some action you'll probably be disappointed. The rooms are cheap for Hollywood and in this economy you will find women, couples, foreign tourists. There are still a few men hanging out here looking for fun, but it is nothing like it's former gay glory days! The desk staff is very friendly & helpful & the housekeepers do a great job! I was very pleased with my stay and was honestly surprised it was as nice as it was for the price. It is also right near the Hollywood/Western station and plenty of restaurants and just a mile or two down the street from all the tourist destinations at Hollywood and Highland. The little garden is very pretty too! Oh and it has free parking and internet!!! You won't find that anywhere else in LA!

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain. I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: DaveW1069
Reviews.Content: The motel is located on Western, just a block off Hollywood Blvd. Easy access by subway. The staff was friendly and courteous and the room was clean. There was a good-sized swimming pool and a hot tub. A plaza next door had a Chinese food place and a Safeway. Other fast food places are a few blocks away, as it a laundry at Western and Sunset. The best part of this motel: NO CHILDREN RUNNING AROUND! The motel does not permit anyone under 18. So we could enjoy the hot tub and the pool in peace and quiet. The only access to the motel was past the front desk clerk, who must buzz you through the locked door. This keeps the "ladies" and other undesirables out. If you want a clean, quiet room close to everything in Hollywood, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Kansas City Traveler”
Reviews.Author: WesternTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Coral Sands Motel between Christmas Ever & New Year's Eve, 2010. Had never been to LA. Was very impressed with the motel's pricing, and location! Real close to restaurants & the Metro. Was disappointed that there was no continental breakfast, or free shuttle from airport, though! Also a drag that "friends" of guests always had to present ID, at the front desk! Also NO PORN available, on tv channels!!! Hotel was v...e...r...y quiet! not too many guests!

Reviews.Title: “First impressions are awful... but it's a bargain and might do in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: Ingmar53
Reviews.Content: You need to know what you're getting into here. This is a run-down motel in a marginal neighborhood that is surprisingly convenient and an incredible bargain. Imagine Scarlett O'Hara's "Tara" in brown stucco--that's the bizarre facade of this place on Western Avenue just north of Hollywood Blvd. Then you walk into a rather dingy "lobby" where the hotelier is behind plexiglass--which is a bit off-putting. After checking-in, the agent "buzzes" you into the central courtyard, where two levels of rooms surround a not-bad pool and spa. The agent advised me to take an upper level room, since the squeaking floors are noisy for those on the lower level. My room had a firm king-size bed adorned with the expected shiny synthetic bedspread. There was a table with two chairs, a small refrigerator and a wall-mount TV with a good-enough selection of cable channels... including HBO. The small bathroom featured a good-sized tiled shower with ample hot water and surprisingly good pressure--actually better than at the 5-star resort I had just come from. The Coral Sands is billed a "gay friendly," and I remember 25 years ago when I worked nearby it was more like a gay bath-house. The activity seems to have been toned down a bit, although I detected men cruising on the terrace level in the evening. And when I checked in I was warned that "visitors" must show photo ID to gain admittance. I have to admit that when I checked in I seriously considered checking out, but the place grew on me. The manager was very friendly; the motel is just a half-block from the Hollywood-Western Metro station (with a Starbucks on the corner), and it's a quick drive to most other points of interest. The bed was comfortable, and while the room was in need of a major rehab, it was clean and had all the basics I needed... and all for $63/night plus tax. Yeah, the extra blanket in the closet had cigarette burns on it, but I needed to be on a budget for this weekend add-on to a business trip, and for that the Coral Sand fit the bill. I'm not sure I'd stay there again, but for those budget travelers who can look past the Coral Sands' cosmetic flaws, it will do in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “No longer suitable for cruising”
Reviews.Author: alexkloo
Reviews.Content: This formerly gay motel is now 'gay friendly' and on this stay I saw three hetero couples hanging out by the pool and a child(!) in the whirlpool. The selection of magazines in the 'gym' / crushed ice area has been pared down - and there are no more porn movies on channel 3 anymore. I'm sorry to say this will be the last time I stay here. I had many fond memories of it as a gay hotel. Shame.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice motel - don't be put off”
Reviews.Author: polarlaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a week at Coral Sands and it was a pleasant experience. We actually returned after our travels and were put in the Suite. It was lovely. Both stays were very comfy, clean and we felt very safe here. Location is great and pool to relax in/by in the afternoon when it got warm was just bliss. Brian, Pablo & Felix were very welcoming and helpful with planning our trips and days out, always ready to help with any questions or problems. Do not be put off by some of the reviews on here and elsewhere, it certainly proved right for us. We will be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite place to stay in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: ITrvltheWorld
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for almost 4 years, and I find it hard to understand why anyone would not gives this place a thumbs up. It is a gay friendly hotel (as are most motel/hotels in the area) with all the good that comes with it. I have seen more "straight couples" here in the last week then ever before. The place is alive and has a great feel and energy about it. The staff are AWESOME, FRIENDLY and most of all HELPFUL. Coral Sands is only one small block away from the Red line subway and is next door to a major grocery store. It is one block away from Hollywood Blvd. The price to quality ratio is high, and they have reduced the room rate's recently. A swimming pool and hot tub to relax at night with just makes this place better then ever. It is safe and secure, your guest have to check in at the front desk, you are called on the phone to say you have a guest waiting, then they buzz him/her in, No one can just walk in. Most rooms have been remodeled and are CLEAN and COMFORTABLE. Tons of FREE parking on site, most hotels/motels charge up to $25.00 a day for this in Los Angeles. I can't speak highly enough of this place, I love coming here, for my money it is the BEST value in all of Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Islandguy808
Reviews.Content: The Coral Sands has a reputation of being a slightly edgy (cruisy) gay men's hotel. They advertise as a gay hotel but on this trip there were famillies with babies staying there. The place is not clean and management is not friendly. The place seems to be changing into a flop house. The evening desk clerk when we checked in was nice but the morning clerk was not. The neighborhood has improved since the Metro subway was built and there is a stop just a half block away. However, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: writer43323
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels during vacation trips to Los Angeles, but I keep coming back to the Coral Sands, because of its low prices, free parking, clean, comfortable rooms and friendly, helpful staff. Every time I visit I notice improvements, and that goes for the neighborhood as well. A big shopping center, with a Ralph's and a Starbucks, is right next door. Sitting poolside, it's easy to meet people at the Coral Sands, and, thanks to the big, firm mattresses on the beds, I slept like a log each night I was there. I'll be going back on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, no amenities, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: astleyboy
Reviews.Content: The staff member was very rude and unhelpful, pointing out all the rules and regualations including giving us a printed summary. Insisted on having identification from both of us, the only hotel/motel in out visit to the States that did so. The lobby is very run down and dingy. The swimming pool was not in use, closed for maintenance but not told this when checking in and impossible to see it from the lobby. Rules state that once you have registered you can not change rooms so you have to accept what they give you. Room old, poorly furnished and dirty. No facilities for making hot drinks or even buying hot drinks from a machine, no breakfast. Worst experience we had in the States, tries to sell itself as gay, rainbow flag on website, two gay porn channels on television, yet is forcible pointed out to you that no nudity is allowed, not even in your room if you can be seen by the public. No free internet connection. They want your money but do not seem to want you there. Never, never, never stay there ever again and would not recommend it to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenk10
Reviews.Content: We visit California twice a year and start and finish each trip in this motel. We stayed there now about 10 times over the past 5 years and we love the place. We don't know what the critics of this place are talking about! The staff is friendly and very helpful. The motel is rather old, the room could do some remodeling, but they are very clean and quiet. Good value for the money. The guests are friendly and social, for a friendly talk or more if you want. Much less attitude than usually in gay hotels. Parking is free and easy. If you are looking for a gay, cruizy, safe, clean and affordable place to stay in Hollywood, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Coral Sands”
Reviews.Author: Bif83
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this Motel since the late 80s when I first discovered it. Over the years the room prices have gone up and the service and quality of the rooms have dipped. While I was there the Dry Sauna seemed to be in disrepair. With that said, I still like staying there when I travel to the LA area. This is a Motel for gay men and best if you are single. The motel patrons provide their own entertainment. I would say Summer is the busy season, but you can stay there on any weekend and enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “it's different but i like it.”
Reviews.Author: hugkoala
Reviews.Content: booked direct and stayed in room 215 from Aug 14-17 2009. motel needs a bit of refurbishing, the room was big enough and with a walk-in wardrobe that fitted our four luggages. Felix was great and very helpful. Bryan was lovely and cheekily informative. (although one of the night shift staff can do with some courses in charm school or guest services relations pointers.) this is your basic no frills motel. plus you have some other actions happening all though the night til the break of dawn. hint hint wink wink!

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang For Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at the coral sands Motel for 1 week. All in all it was not that bad as the previous review. It is an old motel but very clean and very quiet. Parking is much better than other motels that I have stayed in the same area. The staff all were friendly and helpful. I did see some remodeling going on so it most likely will get even better. Do not go there expecting the Ritz- go expecting a clean room and good location to Hollywood/West Hollywood events. If you want more expect to pay way more otherwise this is a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: EL_GQ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night and it was okay. Bathroom was clean and so was the room. It had a mini fridge in a basic room so I thought that was cool. Parking was free. Quiet night and there is some cruising going on however cannot walk around nude. The down fall is that any guest that visits you has to leave their ID at the front desk and there is a fee for that (NOT GOOD). It all depends on what you are expecting to either hook up or get a good sleep. But the price for the night cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: swooshparis
Reviews.Content: Always a nice and quiet place to stay. Friendly staff, nice garden, and convenient location. They will offer you complimentary coffee and doughnuts in the morning and also have a free wi-fi network to connect your laptop. Guests won't especially bother you, even if it gets quite cruisy during week-ends. I certainly wouldn't spend my life there, but for a 4-5 nights stop in L.A., it can't be beaten with such a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: julius7716
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Coral Sands and it still is acceptable considering its $ 79 a night,which is pretty good for LA. The front desk staffing were polite and gave information accurately about the freeways as well as close places to eat. The room, with a king size bed was nice for us taller guys and I guess it must have been one of the smoking rooms due to the resudal aroma. ( Should have asked for non-smoking)..During the day its fairly quiet and your privacy is respected by the other guests and there is no nudity allowed.At night after midnight, there is some cruising going on but it wasn't as bad as years ago.And when the jacuzzi is turned on, it can be heard in the back half of the motel making sleeping at night an adventure.. If you want to be away from the intensity of LA and only be spending $79 per night, its a good base camp.J.Young

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: BIGGGEEL
Reviews.Content: This place was a nightmare. When I got there the room was dirty and smelled bad. People were acting strange and when I tried to leave to go to the store I came back and could not find a place to park. I ended up parking 12 blocks away. Also, the place is like a jail. You cannot bring a guest over or they ask them for their id etc. Bad experience. You'r better off staying at a regular straight motel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the area”
Reviews.Author: Euroboyz
Reviews.Content: While it is not the RItz, it is clean and friendly. Renovations are needed however, the price for the location can not be beat. Much less attitude than the other gay hotels in W. Hollywood. Parking is free and easy, management very friendly and guest even more friendly. If you are looking for a gay, safe, clean and affordable place to stay in Hollywood this is the place. It seems that the gay hotel/motels in Hollywood and W. Hollywood have not put a lot back into their properties. They seem to have the attitude of if you want a gay property take what we have or leave it. This is sad as there seems to be so much potential. Compare Coral Sands to a much cleaner Motel 6 and you are on track as to what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: ledgemusselman
Reviews.Content: What a geat place, I loved it. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Lots of action poolside and in the hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Gay Male Bath House or Motel?”
Reviews.Author: MacToo
Reviews.Content: When the desk clerk asked whether we wanted a first or second floor room, the question seemed strange. Then we discovered that the second floor balcony surrounding the pool was essentially a cruising area. The second surprise came when we were handed our TV remote and two key cards, and informed that our bill was being charged $20 for the remote and $10 for each key card, charges which would be refunded if returned at checkout. The third surprise was the "Visitor's Policy" statement which was given to us after registering. An abbreviated version follows: 1. $10 plus tax for visitors between midnight and 6 AM 2.All guests and visitors must provide photo ID and visitors must leave the ID at the desk until departure. 3. All visitors and registered guests must be over 18 years of age. 4. Management has the right to refuse admittance of any visitor. Also, Nudity is not allowed within public view whether in or out of your room. (A rule which was obviously not observed in actual practice.) What was good about Coral Sands? Clean bathrooms with an abundance of nice towels. Clean sheets. Attractive bedspread with coordinated drapes. What was bad about Coral Sands? Broken light fixture in bathroom with badly rusted medicine cabinet. Insufficient lighting from lamps that are under-powered and dirty. Pillows so flat (worn out) they barely mattered. Terrible TV with only about 8 channels seriously fuzzy and distorted. Dilapidated Sauna which the night clerk didn't know how to operate. Soiled room carpeting. Minimal breakfast with only black coffee so strong the cream barely cut it. No decaf. Only donuts. All-night cruising and noise on the balcony. Summary: This is a place where men can cruise for partners. A bath house would be more "efficient." As a motel it has serious shortcomings. Coral Sands tries to do both and doesn't do either very well, considering the cost. The property is badly run-down and in need of major maintenance improvements.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Place”
Reviews.Author: pmullinsj
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 9 times over the past 5 years and thoroughly adore the place. It's my pleasure to give them some special praise, and I'm glad I can do it here. I know all the staff well, and especially love certain rooms which have a view of the gorgeous garden, beautifully manicured by a gardener daily: It's become lovelier over the years. Except for one early September visit, I always go right before Christmas when it gets very cool at night, and the place has a lot of atmosphere, even a touch of New Orleans to it. I think it's nice to tip some of the staff, as they all do a good job. One of them decorates the lobby in a wonderful splashy style at Christmas, and they will attend to any needs you have, trying to accommodate you. It's old, and I can only pray it lasts, because I much prefer it to the comparable West Hollywood men's hotels, and it's definitely a one-of-a-kind place. By 2002, a big shopping center with a Ralph's and lots of convenient small eateries help the area, but I hope the gentrification stops with that, because there are plenty of nice houses just up Western Avenue that give the neighbourhood plenty of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option for gay traveler wno wants some action”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very old hotel, very private with two stories of rooms around a central courtyard with pool, and above ground spa. I was looking for budget accommodations and $69 a night fit the bill. The room had a king bed, comfortable, small refrigerator, nice size shower (water fluctuated in temperature), and a small bathroom. It was all I needed, and the room was very clean, even thought it was very old in style (think 1950's The Honeymooers decor). Guys walk around with towels around their waist (ala bathhouse), and at night many leave their doors open for fresh air, ETC. It was quiet, yet cruizy. I got a good nights sleep, once I got to bed, and slept well. Coffee (all day) and donuts/croissants in the morning. The spa was very warm. It was October so i didn't try the pool. Dry sauna was old, large, but very cozy. One gay channel on TV 24 hours. The front desk guys were very friendly. The doors from the lobby to the rooms is secured (they buzz you in), and any guests you may have visit are charged $10 and must show picture ID at the desk before they are allowed in to the rooms. I will stay again; i liked the atmosphere, friendly desk people, "eye candy," and the comfortable bed. If you don't mind old, enjoy a cruizy gay environment, you might want to try this place.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Sands visitor for many years”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Coral Sands is an extremely old motel located in an area of Hollywood which to some may appear like a slum but is improving. There is now a new shopping center next to Coral Sands with food and a Starbucks. The hotel carters to gay males. It is a 2 story completely enclosed motel with courtyard area in center. There is a pool, hot tub and dry sauna. Coffee is made around the clock and free of charge and donuts provided each morning. Rooms are decent size with king bed usually. Bathrooms are very small, showers small and water changes to from hot to cold to hot allot. Rooms have a window style air conditioner, small refrigerator and in room gay adult movies provided free. In courtyard the motel policy is no nudity but nothing is said using hot tub or dry sauna nude has this has always been accepted. Just no out in open ---. The hotel is a drive to West Hollywood and it's hot spots so car is usually required. The motel can get busy on weekends but noramlly is quite. Most think that the biggest draw back is the few asian women walking around cleaning the rooms, they are there from 8 to 5 daily. If looking for a inexpensive place to stay with a little action it's not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Motel/Bathhouse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the "Coral Sands" many times over the past 25 years. I really like the place. Guess that's why we keep going back! Our last stay there was for "Gay Pride Weekend 2004. The room had a foul odor. It smelled like bad B.O. My guess, it was coming from the bedspread. Other than that, our stay was great as ever! One complaint in 25 years, that's not bad. The desk clerks are very friendly. I'll go back!

HotelInfo.Name: Coral Sands Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 1730 North Western Ave., Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
